    Plastic Free July: Small Steps, Big Impact

    Every piece of plastic we refuse, replace, or recycle is a vote for a cleaner planet. This Plastic Free July, letâ€™s challenge ourselves to break up with single-use plastics and embrace more sustainable habits.

    Here are a few easy ways to start:

    âœ… Carry a reusable water bottle and coffee cup
    âœ… Say no to plastic straws and cutlery
    âœ… Bring your own bags to the Hub
    âœ… Try bar soap and shampoo bars instead of bottled, or visit our Refill Station!
    âœ… Buy in bulk and choose loose produce

    Plastic pollution is one of the biggest environmental challenges of our timeâ€”but together, our choices do make a difference.

    Join the movement. Inspire others. Go plastic free this Julyâ€”and maybe beyond ðŸ’ªðŸŒ±

    Visit the Plastic Free July website for more resources or to make a pledge.

    Where to find us

    Opening Hours:
    Wednesdays 4-8pm (access via Clarence Street, opposite Travis Perkins)
    Thursdays 10am-2pm (access via main SOFA entrance)
    Saturdays 10am-2pm (access via main SOFA entrance)

    Please note that we have no disabled access on Wednesday evenings. This is due to SOFA being closed and us not having access to the lift, and is sadly beyond our control.
